comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Edison being awarded honorary membership in the Illuminating Engineering Society for his invention of the incandescent bulb and electric lighting systems. The award was made at the Society's convention in New York on February 10th, 1916 at the Hotel Biltmore by John W. Lieb, (as reported by the New York Times, not John L. Lieb, as on the caption) vice president of New York Edison Company. A speech honoring Edison was made by Charles Steinmetz. select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F00C10FE345C1373... books.google.com/books?id=Lp1PAAAAYAAJ&pg=PA623&l... see also ..in which Lieb is identified as John W. A biographical sketch of John William Lieb: www.ieeeghn.org/wiki/images/5/51/Lieb_-_member_bio.pdf

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks so much for your excellent research artolog. We'll make the corrections and add more detail to both records the next time we update.
